Learning to know, learning to do, learning to live together, learning to be: Learning the Treasure Within by UNESCO report for 21st Century.
The holistic vision of Gandhiji is reflected in all these four pillars of learning. Established in 1920, Gujarat Vidyapith was preparing the youth for political independence and reconstruction of India. After 1947, Gujarat Vidyapith focused on providing rural-centric education with scientific spirit to youth. In 1963, with the recognition of Vidyapith as a deemed to be university by the University Grants Commission, the nomenclature of the department of Rural Economics along with the Institute had undergone a change. However, adhering the regulations of the UGC, Gujarat Vidyapith has been successful on keeping some of the Gandhian essence in tact.
Rural Economics has been one of the four core subjects of Gujarat Vidyapith from its inception. With increasing urbanisation, the campus of Gujarat Vidyapith has become urban. Although, the department was connected to rural slums and to an extent to some peripheral villages; its continuous contact with villages was gone. Keeping in mind to renew the rural connect, two rural campuses were established in 1977; in Sadra and Randheja, Gandhinagar District. The Bachelorâ€™ programmes were started in these campuses. At present, the Bachelor; Programme in Rural Economics has been successfully running at Mahadev Deasi Gramseva Kendra, Randheja.
The department was named as Rural Economics with complete concern of identifying itself with the rural economic issues and its economy; looking for solution in Economics framework.

1. Try to develop alternative paradigm with teaching, research and extension for attainment of Sustainable Development.
2. Strive to strengthen theoretical basis of Gandhian economic thought.
3. Thrust on rural economic issues.

1. To orient students of economics in working for strengthening of rural economies on sustainable bases.
